file_summary: This Windows batch script (`.bat`) serves as the Gradle Wrapper executable for Windows environments. Its primary purpose is to prepare the execution environment and launch the `gradle-wrapper.jar` file, which then manages the actual Gradle build. The script first attempts to locate a Java Development Kit (JDK) or Java Runtime Environment (JRE) by checking the `JAVA_HOME` environment variable or searching for `java.exe` in the system's PATH. It sets default JVM options for memory allocation (`-Xmx64m`, `-Xms64m`) and allows users to pass additional JVM arguments via `JAVA_OPTS` and `GRADLE_OPTS`. The script handles error conditions, such as Java not being found or `JAVA_HOME` pointing to an invalid directory, providing informative messages. It ensures that variables are localized to prevent environment pollution and correctly propagates the exit code of the Gradle process.

attributes.name: APP_HOME
attributes.membership: Local variable (resolved absolute path to script's directory)

attributes.name: JAVA_HOME
attributes.membership: Environment variable (path to Java installation, trimmed of quotes)

attributes.name: CLASSPATH
attributes.membership: Local variable (set to empty for wrapper execution)

attributes.name: GRADLE_OPTS
attributes.membership: Environment variable (additional JVM options specific to Gradle)

attributes.name: EXIT_CODE
attributes.membership: Local variable (stores the last error level)

functions.name: :findJavaFromJavaHome
functions.description: Code block to find Java using the JAVA_HOME environment variable.

functions.name: :execute
functions.description: Code block for setting up the command line and executing the Gradle Wrapper JAR.

functions.name: :end
functions.description: Code block for normal script termination, before local scope is ended.

functions.name: :fail
functions.description: Code block for handling script failures and setting the appropriate exit code.

functions.name: :mainEnd
functions.description: Code block for ending local scope for variables on Windows NT after a successful execution.

functions.name: :omega
functions.description: Final, empty label in the script.
